summary: The 'Strengthening Transparency and Obligations to Protect Children Suffering from Abuse and Mistreatment Act of 2025' (STOP CSAM Act) aims to combat child sexual exploitation. It amends existing federal laws to: expand definitions of child abuse and exploitation; enhance protections for child victims and witnesses in federal court; improve reporting requirements for online platforms to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children (NCMEC); and create civil remedies for victims against those who promote or facilitate child pornography or exploitation online. The bill also includes provisions for fines, penalties, and annual reports from tech companies.
